Confirm whether the resulting critical points are minima, maxima, or saddle points using second derivative test or other appropriate tests.
Evaluate the expression at critical points or simplified expressions to compare values and determine the smallest value.
Confirm the smallest value is a minimum by examining the behavior of the function as the variables approach the boundary of their domain or by using limits.
Evaluate the critical solutions in the original inequality to see if solutions are viable under the given constraints (\( x, y, z > 0 \)).
